techDescription: - new item types and attributes to support data lineage
- new item types and attributes for the SQL script loader component
- new attributes to store the information derived from connection JDBC to UDB/SERVER
- the following item types have been dropped from the RIM:
- the following namespace attributs have been dropped from the RIM:
- new attribute to store function signatures
- new attribute to store function return values in case they return a SELECT structure
- new attribute to store technical information in a single JSON attribute
- for zOS support added item type UDB/SCHEMA to IN-SERVER namespace
Replaced DEFINITION by DEFINITION.UDB for all item types in UDB model.

propertyDefs.description: SQL string delimiter for SQL statements in the package

techDescription: N = The package is not associated with an anonymous block
Y = The package is associated with an anonymous block
applCompatibility ............  The application compatibility level of the package
The application compatibility level of the package:
Specifies the application compatibility behavior of the function-level
function level. The equivalent function level or higher must be activated.
The format is VvvRrMmmm, where vv is the version, r is the release, and mmm
Identifies compatibility with the current highest available function level, function level 503.
Identifies compatibility with the function level that enables new function in the initial Db2 12 release, function level 500. V12R1M500 is the same as V12R1.
Identifies compatibility with the function level before you activate new function, after migration to Db2 12, function level 100. V12R1M100 is the same as V11R1.
For a list of supported function-level values, see What's new in Db2 12 function levels.
applRetainDup ................  The value of the APRETAINDUP bind option
APRETAINDUP YES specified. All copies were retained.
APRETAINDUP NO specified; however, the previous or original package copy is
still retained due to access path differences.
APRETAINDUP NO specified, and the previous package copy is not retained as
the access paths are identical to the current copy.
APRETAINDUP NO specified, and the previous and original package copies are
not retained as the access paths are identical to the current copy.
applReuse ....................  The value of the APREUSE bind option
NO or NONE: Access paths are not reused.
WARN: DB2 tries to reuse access paths. Processing continues when an access
ERROR: DB2 tries to reuse access paths. Processing ends when an access path
archiveSensitivity ...........  The value of the ARCHIVESENSITIVE bind option
References to archive-enabled tables are affected by the value of the
SYSIBMADM.GET_ARCHIVE built-in global variable. Y is the default value.
References to archive-enabled tables are not affected by the value of the
averageSize ..................  Average size, in bytes, of those sections1 of the plan that contain SQL statements processed at bind time
businessTimeSensitive ........  The value of the BUSTIMESENSITIVE bind option
References to application-period temporal tables are affected by the value
of the CURRENT TEMPORAL BUSINESS_TIME special register.
References to application-period temporal tables are not affected by the
value of the CURRENT TEMPORAL BUSINESS_TIME special register.
ccsid ........................  The CCSID value for CHAR, VARCHAR, CLOB, DATE, TIME, TIMESTAMP, GRAPHIC, VARGRAPHIC, DBCLOB, and DATALINK columns.
Contains 65535 if the column is a BINARY, VARBIN, BLOB, or ROWID.
Contains the null value if the column is a numeric data type.
characterSet .................  Indicates whether the system CCSID for SBCS data was 290 (Katakana) when the program was precompiled
codePage .....................  Code page of the object. This is the default code page used for all character columns, triggers, check constraints, and expression-generated columns.
comma ........................  Decimal point representation for SQL statements in package
concurrentAccessResolution ...  Indicates the CONCURRENTACCESSRESOLUTION option when the package was bound or rebound
dateTimeFormat ...............  Date and time format associated with the package
0 = Format associated with the territory code of the client
dbPartitionNumber ............  Number of the database partition where the package was bound
dbProtocol ...................  Whether remote access for SQL with three-part names is implemented with private protocol access
dec31 ........................  Indicates whether DEC31 was in effect when the package's program was precompiled
deferPrep ....................  Indicates the CURRENTDATA option when the package was bound or rebound
Data currency is required for all cursors. Inhibit blocking for all cursors.
Data currency is not required for ambiguous cursors.
Data currency is required for ambiguous cursors.
The package was created before the CURRENTDATA option was available.
deferPrepare .................  Whether the package was last bound with the DEFER(PREPARE) option
Bind option NODEFER(PREPARE) indicates that PREPARE processing is not deferred until OPEN is executed.
Bind option DEFER(PREPARE) indicates that PREPARE processing is deferred until OPEN is executed.
The local package is inheriting the value from the plan
Bind option not specified for the package. It is inherited from the plan.
degree .......................  The DEGREE option used when the plan was last bound
DEGREE(1). Blank if the plan was migrated
descStat .....................  The value of the DESCSTAT bind option
The DB2 database manager generates a DESCRIBE SQLDA at bind time so that
DESCRIBE requests for static SQL can be satisfied during execution.
The DB2 database manager does not generate a DESCRIBE SQLDA at bind time for
distribute ...................  Determines if DB2 should gather location names from SQL statements, and create remote packages for the user
DB2 will collect remote location names from SQL statements during local
bind, and automatically create remote packages at those sites. The site
names are gathered from object names in static SQL statements and literals
on CONNECT statements. The sites at which the package is remotely bound can
be determined by the location (BTYPE='X') records in SYSIBM.SYSPACKDEP for
DB2 will automatically create remote packages at the sites specified in the
list of location-names. The sites at which the package is remotely bound can
be determined by the location (BTYPE='X') records in SYSIBM.SYSPACKDEP for
dynamicRules .................  The DYNAMICRULES option used when the plan was last bound
BIND. Dynamic SQL statements are executed with DYNAMICRULES bind behavior.
RUN. Dynamic SQL statements in the plan are executed with DYNAMICRULES run behavior.
envStringUnits ...............  Default string units when the object was created.
explain ......................  EXPLAIN option specified for the plan
explainLevel .................  Indicates whether Explain was requested using the EXPLAIN or EXPLSNAP bind option
explainMode ..................  Value of the EXPLAIN bind option
explainSnapshot ..............  Value of the EXPLSNAP bind option
explicitBindTS ...............  Time at which this package was last changed by BIND or REBIND
extendedIndicator ............  The value of the EXTENDEDINDICATOR bind option
N = FEDERATED bind or prep option is turned off
U = FEDERATED bind or prep option was not specified
Y = FEDERATED bind or prep option is turned on
federatedAsynchrony ..........  Indicates the limit on asynchrony (the number of ATQs in the plan) as a bind option when the package was bound
-1 = Degree of asynchrony determined by the system
For a non-federated system, the value is 0.
functionResolveTS ............  Timestamp when the function was resolved. Set by the BIND and REBIND commands, but not by AUTOBIND.
hostLanguage .................  Host language for the package's DBRM
VS COBOL II or IBM® COBOL Release 1 (formerly called COBOL/370)
For remotely bound packages, trigger packages (TYPE='T'), SQL procedure
packages (TYPE='N'), or non-inline SQL scalar function packages (TYPE='F').
iaspNumber ...................  Specifies the independent auxiliary storage pool (IASP) number
immediateWrite ...............  Indicates when writes of updated group buffer pool dependent pages are to be done
Bind option IMMEDWRITE(NO) indicates normal write activity is done.
Bind option IMMEDWRITE(YES) indicates that immediate writes are done for updated group buffer pool dependent pages.
Bind option IMMEDWRITE(PH1) indicates that updated group buffer pool dependent pages are written at or before phase 1 commit.
insertBuffer .................  Setting of the INSERT bind option (applies to partitioned database systems)
Y = Inserts are buffered at the coordinator member to minimize traffic among members
intraParallel ................  Use of intrapartition parallelism by static SQL statements within the package
F = One or more static SQL statements in this package can use intrapartition
parallelism; this parallelism has been disabled for use on a system that is
N = No static SQL statement uses intrapartition parallelism
Y = One or more static SQL statements in the package use intrapartition parallelism
keepDynamic ..................  Whether prepared dynamic statements are to be purged at each commit point
The bind option is KEEPDYNAMIC(NO). Prepared dynamic SQL statements are destroyed at commit or rollback.
The bind option is KEEPDYNAMIC(YES). Prepared dynamic SQL statements are kept past commit or rollback.
languageLevel ................  Setting of the LANGLEVEL bind option
lastBindTS ...................  Time at which the package was last changed by BIND or REBIND
memberNumber .................  Number of the member where the package was bound
mixed ........................  Indicates if mixed data was in effect when the package's program was precompiled
multiNodePlans ...............  Whether package was bound in a partitioned database
N = Package was not bound in a partitioned database environment
Y = Package was bound in a partitioned database environment
operative ....................  Whether the application plan can be allocated
No; an explicit BIND or REBIND is required before the plan can be allocated
optHint ......................  Value of the OPTHINT bind option. Identifies rows in the owner.PLAN_TABLE to be used as input to DB2.
osPointerSize ................  Word size for the platform on which the package was created
packageSections ..............  Number of sections in the package
pkSize .......................  Size of the base section of the package, in bytes
planManagement ...............  The value of the PLANMGMT bind option
planManagementScope ..........  The value of the PLANMGMTSCOPE bind option
precompileTS .................  Date and time the application program was precompiled
queryOpt .....................  Optimization class under which this package was bound. Used for rebind operations

refreshAge ...................  Timestamp duration indicating the maximum length of time between execution of a REFRESH TABLE statement for a materialized query table (MQT) and when that MQT is used in place of a base table.
releaseBound .................  The release when the package was bound or rebound.
Package was created by BIND COPY.
Package was created by BIND COPY with the OPTIONS(COMMAND) option.
The package was copied from a package that was originally bound on behalf of a remote requester.
The package was copied with the OPTIONS(COMMAND) option from a package that was originally bound on behalf of a remote requester.
Package was locally bound from a DBRM.
Package was bound on behalf of a remote requester.
reoptVar .....................  Whether the access path is determined again at execution time using input variable values
Bind option REOPT(AUTO) indicates that the access path is determined multiple times at execution time depending on the parameter value.
Bind option REOPT(NONE) indicates that the access path is determined at bind time.
Bind option REOPT(ALWAYS) indicates that the access path is determined at execution time for SQL statements with variable values.

Bind option REOPT(ONCE) indicates that the access path is determined only once at execution time, using the first set of input variable values, regardless of how many times the same statement is executed
roundingMode .................  Indicates the DECFLOAT rounding mode of the materialized query table or view.
sqlError .....................  Indicates the SQLERROR option on the most recent subcommand that bound or rebound the package

sqlMathWarn ..................  Value of the dft_sqlmathwarn database configuration parameter at bind time. Indicates whether arithmetic and retrieval conversion errors return warnings and null values (indicator -2), allowing query processing to continue whenever possible.
sqlWarn ......................  Indicates whether or not positive SQLCODEs resulting from dynamic SQL statements are returned to the application
staticAsDynamic ..............  Process static statements like dynamic ones
N = All static SQL statements in the package are compiled at bind time,
Y = All static SQL statements in the package are compiled at execution time,
staticReadOnly ...............  Indicates whether or not static cursors will be treated as READ ONLY
I = Any static cursor that does not contain the FOR UPDATE clause is
N = Static cursors take on the attributes that would normally be generated
for the given statement text and the setting of the LANGLEVEL precompile
Y = Any static cursor that does not contain the FOR UPDATE or the FOR READ
ONLY clause is considered READ ONLY
sysEntries ...................  Number of rows associated with the plan in SYSIBM.SYSPLSYSTEM.
systemTimeSensitive ..........  The value of the SYSTIMESENSITIVE bind option
References to system-period temporal tables are affected by the value of the
References to system-period temporal tables are not affected by the value of
the CURRENT TEMPORAL SYSTEM_TIME special register.
transformationGroup ..........  Value of the TRANSFORM GROUP bind option
type .........................  Type of package. Identifies how the package is created
A CREATE FUNCTION or ALTER FUNCTION statement, or a BIND PACKAGE DEPLOY command created the package, and this package is a compiled SQL scalar function package.
A CREATE PROCEDURE or ALTER PROCEDURE statement, or BIND PACKAGE DEPLOY command created the package, and this package is a native SQL routine package.
BIND PACKAGE command created the package
valid ........................  Indicates if object is valid.
A = An ALTER TABLE statement changed the description of the table or base table of a view that is referred
For a CREATE INDEX statement involving data sharing, VALID is also marked as "A".
H = An ALTER TABLE statement changed the description of the table or base table of a view that is referred
X = Object is inoperative and must be re-created
validate .....................  Whether validity checking can be deferred until run time
All checking must be performed during BIND.
Validation is done at run time for tables, views, and privileges that do not exist at bind time.

propertyDefs.description: Stores the indexes key expressions line by line.
techDescription: For INDEX definitions containing key expressions this attribute contains
all expressions and non expression columns used to create the index key
Each line of this attribute contains a single expression or a key column.

propertyDefs.description: Links an index to the table columns it uses
techDescription: This attribute links the index to the columns used to compose the index.
The format of each entry is:
if the link qualifier is missing the link results from an expression
<colseq>     is a 6 digit unique number to identify the sequence of the columns in the key
<order>      can be ASC, DESC, INC or RND for ASCENDING, DESCENDING, INCLUDE or RANDOM
<exp>        For KEY EXPRESSIONS <exp> is the linenumber of the current key expression in

propertyDefs.description: If the index is sparse, contains the search condition.
Defines whether the index is unique
techDescription: V        Yes (duplicate NULL values are allowed)
C        Yes, and it is used to enforce the uniqueness of a
UNIQUE constraint or hash key columns.
P        Yes, and it is a primary index (As in prior
releases of DB2, a value of P is used for primary
keys that are used to enforce a referential
N        Yes, and it is defined with UNIQUE WHERE NOT NULL
R        Yes, and it is an index used to enforce the
uniqueness of a non-primary parent key
G        Yes, and it is an index used to enforce the
uniqueness of values in a column defined as
X        Yes, and it is an index used to enforce the
uniqueness of values in a column that is used to
identify or find XML values associated with a
closeRule ...............  Whether the data sets are candidates for closure when the limit on the number of open data sets is reached
clusterFactor ...........  Finer measurement of the degree of clustering
clusterRatio ............  Degree of data clustering with the index
clustered ...............  Whether the table is actually clustered by the index
A significant number of rows are not in clustering order, or statistics have not been gathered.
Most of the rows are in clustering order.
clustering ..............  Whether CLUSTER was specified for the index
N = Index compression is not active
copy ....................  Whether COPY YES was specified for the index
Indicates if the index can be copied and if SYSIBM.SYSLGRNX recording is enabled for the index.
currentVersion ..........  The version number describing the newest format of data in the index space.
A zero indicates that the index space has never had been versioned.
After the version number reaches the maximum value, the number will wrap back to one
density .................  Ratio of SEQUENTIAL_PAGES to number of pages
Ratio of SEQUENTIAL_PAGES to number of pages in the range of pages occupied by
the index, expressed as a percent (integer between 0 and 100); -1 if statistics
envStringUnits ..........  Default string units when the object was created.
eraseRule ...............  Whether the data sets are erased when dropped. The value is meaningless if the index is partitioned
firstKeyCard ............  Number of distinct first-key values; -1 if statistics are not collected
fullKeyCard .............  Number of distinct full-key values; -1 if statistics are not collected.
hash ....................  Whether the index is the hash overflow index for a hash table
indexExtensionType ......  Identifies the type of extended index
indexSpace ..............  Name of the index space
keyTargetCount ..........  The number of key-targets for an extended index. The value is 0 for a simple index
madeUnique ..............  Indicates whether an index was forced to be unique
N = Index remains as it was created.
Y = Index was originally non-unique but
was converted to a unique index to
support a unique or primary key
constraint. If the constraint is dropped, the
nLeaf ...................  Number of active leaf pages in the index.
Number of active leaf pages in the index. The value is -1 if statistics have not
been gathered. This is an updatable column.
nLevels .................  Number of levels in the index tree.
oldestVersion ...........  The version number describing the oldest format of data in the index space and any image copies of the index.
padded ..................  Indicates whether keys within the index are padded for varying-length column data
The index contains varying-length character or graphic data and is PADDED (the varying-length columns are padded to their maximum length).

If the default value is a string constant or a hexadecimal constant (DEFAULT is
